channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: FBI searches home of former Trump adviser John Bolton
item.description: The FBI said its search of Bolton's home was authorized by a court, but declined to provide further details. Bolton is a frequent critic of the presid...

item.title: U.N.-backed panel confirms famine in Gaza. And, DOJ to send Congress some Epstein docs
item.description: A U.N.-backed panel of experts has declared that northern Gaza is suffering from famine. And, the DOJ is expected to release to Congress the first wav...

item.title: Famine confirmed in northern Gaza, says U.N.-backed agency
item.description: Famine has been officially declared in northern Gaza, a U.N.-backed group warns — marking the first such confirmation in the Middle East.

item.title: Thai court acquits ex-Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra of royal defamation charge
item.description: Thailand's former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra was acquitted of a royal defamation charge by a court on Friday, in a case that could have sent hi...

item.title: These programs help poor students with college. Trump wants to pull the funding
item.description: For 60 years, TRIO has helped millions of people along the path to a degree, but the administration says it is no longer needed.

item.title: Exclusive discounts from CBS Mornings Deals
item.description: On this edition of CBS Mornings Deals, we show you items that might just become essentials in your everyday life. Visit cbsdeals.com to take advantage...

item.title: US to review all 55 million visas to check if holders broke rules
item.description: A US state department official says US visa holders will face "continuous vetting".

item.title: Redistricting tug-of-war bounces back to Texas after California lawmakers counterpunch
Lyle Menendez set for parole board hearing day after brother was denied
item.description: A panel denied Erik Menendez, Lyle's brother, parole after a 10-hour hearing on Thursday.

item.title: Riz Ahmed talks "Relay," acting roots and finding balance as an artist
item.description: In a conversation with Anthony Mason, Riz Ahmed reflects on starring in the new action thriller "Relay," his beginnings in London theater, his breakou...

item.title: Sri Lanka's former president Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested
item.description: Ranil Wickremesinghe has been arrested in connection with the alleged misuse of funds, officials said.

item.title: AP analysis shows Texas and California redistricting efforts could mess with rare partisan balance
item.description: Moves by Texas Republicans and California Democrats to redraw their U.S. House districts could disrupt a rare partisan balance in American politics.

item.title: Former Thai PM Thaksin acquitted in royal insult case
item.description: The former PM's lese majeste charge relates to an interview he did with a South Korean newspaper years ago.

item.title: Fed Chair Jerome Powell signals path to rate cuts at Jackson Hole
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has been under pressure from President Trump to lower the central bank's benchmark interest rate.

item.title: "Sesame Street" icon Sonia Manzano inspires kids with new book
item.description: Beloved "Sesame Street" star Sonia Manzano, known for her role as Maria, joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about her new bilingual children's book "Alma's ...

item.title: 'My youngest child doesn't know what fruit tastes like': Gaza residents on famine
item.description: A UN-backed body says more than half a million people across Gaza are facing "starvation, destitution and death".

item.title: Nigeria deports Chinese scammers in crackdown on 'foreign-led' cyber crime
item.description: A total of 102 deported foreigners have been convicted of "cyber-terrorism and internet fraud" this week.

item.title: Florida must stop expanding ‘Alligator Alcatraz’ immigration center, judge says
